text.text: Financial protection plans are designed to help you plan for the unexpected—and help protect the financial future for you and your family.

text_copy.text:
Life insurance is designed to help give your family financial security in the event of your death, helping them meet end-of-life expenses and other financial obligations.

This term life insurance policy pays cash benefits directly to the people you have identified as a beneficiary. The money can be used to help pay for funeral expenses, rent, mortgage, education costs and more.

text_441092740.text:
{selectedOption.highlightsBasicLifeInsurance.copy}

{selectedOption.highlightsSupplementalLifeInsurance.copy}

{selectedOption.highlightsAccidentalDeathLifeInsurance.copy}

View benefits in the plan — Benefit Summary

text.text:
• Have access to advice and consultative services if you are traveling more than 100 miles from home.
  • Have access to medical assistance services, including worldwide medical and dental referrals and more.
  • Have access to travel assistance services including help to replace lost or stolen travel documents and more.

• Get help to create a will, trust and power of attorney legal document (registration required).
  • Find local attorneys, search legal forms and have access to helpful articles written by legal experts.
  • Have access to financial planning help.

• Have unlimited phone access to master’s-level specialists, 24/7.
  • Have up to 2 face-to-face grief counseling sessions, with access to a national network of licensed clinicians.

• Call our coordinators 24/7 for guidance closing an estate and protecting your loved one’s identity.
  • Request guidance on how to get death certificate copies and manage notifications from the Social Security Administration, credit reporting agencies, and others.
  • Obtain assistance with helping to protect your loved one's identity with a credit report review, credit freeze or account closure with all credit bureaus, and resolution and recovery services in the event of identity theft.
  • Work with coordinators to discontinue social media access to loved one's accounts.

• Easily and securely find a provider, and discover community and grief-support resources online.
  • Find news, events, articles and expert advice, and learn about conditions and issues that may be affecting your life.

• One 30 to 60-minute financial consultation with a credentialed financial professional who can discuss estate taxes and other financial matters.
  • One 30-minute legal consultation. Beneficiaries can also retain an attorney for ongoing services at a discounted rate.

Help protect one of your most important assets — your ability to earn an income. A disability insurance plan will give you a portion of your earnings if you can't work because of a disabling illness or injury.

Short-term disability insurance provides you with a portion of your weekly income if you have a qualifying disability and are unable to work. The weekly payments will help you pay expenses such as medical bills, mortgage or rent, food and more.

  • Receive monthly payments until you return to your job or reach the end of the benefit period, whichever comes first. 
  • Work part-time and still receive benefit payments.
  • Have access to disability specialists who can work with you and your employer to help you make a successful return to the workplace.

View benefits in the plan — Benefit Summary

Long-term disability insurance provides you with a portion of your monthly income if you have a qualifying disability and are unable to work for a long period of time. The monthly payments will help you pay expenses such as medical bills, mortgage or rent, food and more.

  • Receive monthly payments until you return to your job or reach the end of the benefit period, whichever comes first,
  • Work part-time and still receive benefit payments,
  • Have access to disability specialists who can work with you and your employer to help you make a successful return to the workplace.

View benefits in the plan — Benefit Summary

To help you through difficult times, the UnitedHealthcare Member Assistance Program (MAP) provides personal and confidential support, 24/7. As a member, you and your family will have access to:

  • Unlimited phone access to master’s-level specialists, 24/7.
  • Up to 3 referrals for face-to-face counseling sessions* .
  • One legal consultation of 30 minutes, with a choice to meet with an attorney by telephone or in-person to discuss legal concerns** .
  • A 30 – 60 minute financial consultation with credentialed financial professionals.  

 

*There is no charge for referrals or for seeing a clinician within our network for up to 3 visits per issue.

**Due to the potential for a conflict of interest, legal consultation will not be provided on issues that may involve legal action against UnitedHealthcare, its affiliates or any entity through which the caller is receiving services directly or indirectly.

For help protecting your budget from high hospital bills, hospital indemnity can work alongside your health plan by paying you cash after hospital care. You can use the cash any way you choose—from paying hospital stay expenses to your health care deductible to out-of-pocket costs and more.

• Timely cash payments are made directly to you after hospital care.
  • Use the cash payments to help pay your deductible, expenses related to your hospital stay, or in any way you choose.

{selectedOption.showClaimAdvocateHelpBulletHip.copy}

{selectedOption.showPortableCoverageBulletHip.copy}

• Hospital admission
  • Hospital confinement
  • Intensive care unit (ICU) confinement

• Hospital admission
  • Hospital confinement
  • Intensive care unit (ICU) confinement
  • ICU admission

• Hospital admission
  • Hospital confinement
  • Intensive care unit (ICU) confinement
  • ICU admission and more

text_1719337253.text: View benefits in the plan — Benefit Summary

accordionItem0.title: Get paid for receiving health screenings

text.text:
The wellness benefit included in this plan provides one payment per year for a set dollar amount for one health screening test for you and your covered spouse.

Examples of these tests are:

  • Chest x-ray
  • Colonoscopy
  • Pap smear
  • Mammogram
  • PSA (blood test for prostate cancer) and more

text_1717796458_copy.text: IMPORTANT: Some benefits may not be available in all states

text.text: Protect your finances and your family against the impact of a critical illness. Critical illness insurance helps ensure that, should you be diagnosed with a critical illness, you’ll have financial support to help you with paying daily living expenses.

• Lump sum payment is paid directly to you after your diagnosis for a covered critical illness.
  • Use the payment in any way you choose such as helping pay your mortgage or rent, your deductible or other health care expenses such as medications and transportation to and from appointments.   

{selectedOption.showClaimAdvocateHelpBulletCip.copy}

{selectedOption.showPortableCoverageBulletCip.copy}

Covered illnesses include:

  • Benign brain tumor
  • Cancer – invasive
  • Cancer – non-invasive (25%)
  • Chronic renal failure
  • Coma
  • Coronary artery disease (25%)
  • Heart attack
  • Heart failure
  • Major organ failure
  • Permanent paralysis
  • Ruptured aneurysm
  • Stroke

Covered Illnesses are:

  • Advanced Alzheimer’s
  • Advanced multiple sclerosis
  • Advanced Parkinson’s
  • Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
  • Complete blindness
  • Complete loss of hearing

This coverage is included with your employee coverage and includes children from birth to age 26. Benefits are 25% of your employee coverage. One covered condition per child.

Covered illnesses are:

  • Cerebral Palsy
  • Cleft Lip/Palate
  • Down Syndrome and more

text_1717796458.text: PLEASE NOTE: Some benefits may not be available in all states

text.text:
Prepare for the unexpected with accident insurance that helps reimburse you if you receive care for a covered injury.

Accident insurance sends you a payment if you have a covered injury. The amount you receive will be based on the covered expenses, which may include emergency room services, surgeries, recovery care and more.

• Lump sum payment is paid directly to you after you submit your claim request and we verify it’s for a covered injury.
  • Use the payment in any way you choose such as helping pay your mortgage or rent, your deductible or other out of pocket expenses.

{selectedOption.showClaimAdvocateHelpBulletApp.copy}

{selectedOption.showPortableCoverageBulletApp.copy}

Covered injuries include:

  • Dislocations
  • Emergency room treatment
  • Hospital admission
  • Hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU) admission
  • Hospital stays
  • Lacerations
  • Loss of fingers and toes
  • Transportation (ambulance) and more

Covered injuries include:

  • Emergency room treatment
  • Hospital admission
  • Hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU) admission
  • Hospital stays
  • Loss of fingers and toes
  • Transportation (ambulance) and more

• Emergency room treatment
  • Follow-up physician visit
  • Hospital admission
  • Hospital Intensive Care Unit (ICU) admission
  • Hospital stays
  • Lacerations
  • Loss of fingers and toes
  • Major diagnostic exam 
  • Transportation (ambulance) and more
